content: अंजनः {@--1@} A kind of lizard. {@--2@} <ab>N.</ab> of a tree or mountain. {@--3@} <ab>N.</ab> of the guardian elephant (of the west or s. w.) --नं [अज्यते अनेन; अंज् ल्युट्] {@--1@} Anointing, smearing with; दंतधावनमंजनं पूर्वाह्ण एव कुर्वीत <ls>Ms. 4. 152</ls>; mixing; unfolding, manifesting. {@--2@} Collyrium or black pigment used to paint the eye-lashes; विलोचनं दक्षिणमंजनेन संभाव्य <ls>R. 7. 8</ls> salve; अमृत° <ls>U. 4. 19</ls> ambrosial salve; कुर्वन् °मेचका इव दिशो मेघः समुत्तिष्ठते <ls>Mk. 5. 8</ls>, <ls n="Mk.">1. 34</ls>; (<ab>fig.</ab> also) अज्ञानांधस्य लोकस्य ज्ञानांजनशलाकया . चक्षुरुन्मीलितं येन तस्मै पाणिनये नमः <ls>Śik. 45</ls>; पटुतरविवेकांजनजुषां <ls>Bh. 3. 84</ls>; <ab>cf.</ab> also दारिद्र्यं परमांजनं; (<ab>fig.</ab>) impurity, as in निरंजन, <ab>q. v.</ab> {@--3@} Paint, a cosmetic ointment. {@--4@} Magic ointment. {@--5@} A special kind of material of the black pigment, such as antimony (used as collyrium, lamp-black &c.) (सौवीर) {@--6@} Ink. {@--7@} Fire. {@--8@} Night. {@--9@} (नं ना) (<ab>Rhet.</ab>) A suggested meaning; also the process by which such meaning is suggested. It is the power of suggestion (founded on अभिधा or लक्षणा denotation or indication), by which something else is understood from a word which, though having more meanings than one, has been restricted to a single meaning by relations of conjunction, disjunction &c. (संयोग, विप्रयोग, साहचर्य, विरोधिता &c.), or, briefly, the use of a word of several meanings in a special sense determined by the context; {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} सशंखचक्रो हरिः the adjective restricts Hari to mean ‘Vishṇu’ alone, and not ‘a lion’ or ‘monkey’; so रामलक्ष्मणौ दाशरथी, रामार्जुनौ भार्गवकार्तवीर्यौ &c.; <ab>cf.</ab> अनेकार्थस्य शब्दस्य वाचकत्वे नियंत्रिते . संयोगाद्यैरवाच्यार्थधीकृद्व्यापृतिरंजनं .. <ls>K. P. 2.</ls>, <ls>S. D. 23-6</ls>; See व्यंजना also.
